title: Porn shown at Brazilian bus station after hackers infiltrate display screens

Travellers got a rude surprise at a bus station in Brazil when hackers took control of display screens and broadcast a porn video.
The sex footage was shown on screens that normally display arrival and departure times for passengers at the Boqueirao station in the southern city of Curitiba.
The prank left staff scrambling to turn off the footage, which ran for 15 minutes and was viewed by children.
Photos snapped by shocked passengers have gone viral on social media in the South American country
The depot was packed with travellers at the time.
Photos snapped by shocked passengers have gone viral on social media in the South American country, although police did not consider it a laughing matter.
 American Airlines passenger records terrifying moment FLAMES... Glories The cyber crime unit is trying to trace the hackers, said Curitiba’s municipal transport company.
A city hall official said a contracted company is responsible for the screens, and has been told to improve its security.
The police cyber crime unit is trying to trace the hackers, said Curitiba’s municipal transport company
With a population of around two million, Curitiba is the capital of Parana state and one of the largest cities in southern Brazil.
In a similar incident last week, porn was accidentally shown on a large display screen on the wall of a busy shopping mall in Lishui, China.
Officials said a worker was watching the video on a computer used for displaying advertisements on the LED screen.
The video was shown for about nine minutes at the downtown Wandi Plaza, Xinhua reported.
